description: Robert was born on Oct. 4, 1944, in Fairmont, W.V. He and his father moved around the country before finally settling in Iron. He graduated from the University of Minnesota Duluth with a degree in Economics. Robert is survived by his wife of 50 years, Carolyn; sons, Jay of Esko and Travis of North Branch; grandchildren: Leah, JR, Anthony, Lizzie, Payton, Graham, and Sayer; and his...
text:
Robert Hartlieb, 75, of Iron passed away peacefully on Thursday, May 28, 2020,
with his loving family by his side.

Robert was born on Oct. 4, 1944, in Fairmont, W.V. He and his father moved
around the country before finally settling in Iron. Robert served in the U.S.
Army for two years. He graduated from the University of Minnesota  Duluth
with a degree in Economics.

He met Carolyn Passeri in 1967 and they married June 28, 1969. They were
fortunate enough to have celebrated their 50th wedding anniversary surrounded
by family. Robert had many different jobs from house building to insurance
salesman before finally working at EvTac for 26 years. He retired in 2007. He
and Carolyn enjoyed their retirement by splitting their time between Minnesota
in the summer and St. Petersburg, Fla., in the winter. Robert enjoyed being
the "fun" grandpa with his grandchildren by parasailing, riding roller
coasters, and playing games.

Robert is survived by his wife of 50 years, Carolyn; sons, Jay (Kelly) of Esko
and Travis (Shawnna) of North Branch; grandchildren: Leah, JR, Anthony,
Lizzie, Payton, Graham, and Sayer; and his great-granddaughter; Mila, who he
had the privilege to meet.

He was preceded in death by his father, Robert Sr.

Robert's family would like to thank the Mayo for the excellent care that they
provided in his last few weeks.

Funeral: There will be a Mass of Christian Burial at 11 a.m. Tuesday, June 2,
at Resurrection Catholic Church in Eveleth. In addition, A celebration of life
will be held for Robert from 5 to 8 p.m. on Tuesday, June 2, at the Hartlieb
residence.

Visitation: Friends and family are invited to attend the visitation from 5 to
7 p.m. Monday, June 1, at Dougherty Funeral Home of Hibbing.

Burial: Interment will follow mass at the Maple Hill Cemetery in Hibbing.

Arrangements entrusted to the Dougherty Funeral Home. To sign the guest book
and offer an online tribute, see
[www.doughertyofhibbing.com](http://www.doughertyofhibbing.com).

title: Robert Hartlieb
html:
Robert Hartlieb, 75, of Iron passed away peacefully on Thursday, May 28, 2020, with his loving family by his side.

Robert was born on Oct. 4, 1944, in Fairmont, W.V. He and his father moved around the country before finally settling in Iron. Robert served in the U.S. Army for two years. He graduated from the University of Minnesota – Duluth with a degree in Economics.

He met Carolyn Passeri in 1967 and they married June 28, 1969. They were fortunate enough to have celebrated their 50th wedding anniversary surrounded by family. Robert had many different jobs from house building to insurance salesman before finally working at EvTac for 26 years. He retired in 2007. He and Carolyn enjoyed their retirement by splitting their time between Minnesota in the summer and St. Petersburg, Fla., in the winter. Robert enjoyed being the "fun" grandpa with his grandchildren by parasailing, riding roller coasters, and playing games.

Robert is survived by his wife of 50 years, Carolyn; sons, Jay (Kelly) of Esko and Travis (Shawnna) of North Branch; grandchildren: Leah, JR, Anthony, Lizzie, Payton, Graham, and Sayer; and his great-granddaughter; Mila, who he had the privilege to meet.

He was preceded in death by his father, Robert Sr.

Robert's family would like to thank the Mayo for the excellent care that they provided in his last few weeks.

Funeral: There will be a Mass of Christian Burial at 11 a.m. Tuesday, June 2, at Resurrection Catholic Church in Eveleth. In addition, A celebration of life will be held for Robert from 5 to 8 p.m. on Tuesday, June 2, at the Hartlieb residence.

Visitation: Friends and family are invited to attend the visitation from 5 to 7 p.m. Monday, June 1, at Dougherty Funeral Home of Hibbing.

Burial: Interment will follow mass at the Maple Hill Cemetery in Hibbing.

Arrangements entrusted to the Dougherty Funeral Home. To sign the guest book and offer an online tribute, see www.doughertyofhibbing.com.
